00051 class TreeVisitor : public PDI::ConstVisitor
00052 {
00053 public:
00054 /*type     := 'UINT'
00055          |  'INT'
00056          |  'BOOL'
00057          |  'FLOAT'
00058          |  'ASCII'
00059          |  'PAD'
00060          |  array
00061 */
00062 
00073    TreeVisitor(const std::string& sName, bool bDisplayOutputToScreen = false) :
00074       m_sName(sName),
00075       m_bDisplayOutputToScreen(bDisplayOutputToScreen),
00076       m_pInstruction(0)
00077    {
00078       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["INT"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::IntElement>;
00079       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["UINT"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::UintElement>;
00080       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["BOOL"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::BoolElement>;
00081       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["FLOAT"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::FloatElement>;
00082       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["ASCII"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::AsciiElement>;
00083       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["PAD"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::PadElement>;
00084    }
00085 
00089    BabelShark::Instruction* GetInstruction() { return m_pInstruction; }
00090 
00091 private:
00100    template <typename InstructionTypeT>
00101    BabelShark::Instruction* CreateInstruction(unsigned int nSize, const std::string& sName)
00102    {
00103       char* s = const_cast<char*>(sName.c_str());
00104           // This would be easier if std::string was the parameter type rather than char*.
00105       return new InstructionTypeT(nSize, s);
00106    }
00107 
00114    virtual void Visit(const PDI::Array& array) {
00115       if (m_bDisplayOutputToScreen)
00116       {
00117          std::cout << "This array node has been visited " << m_sName << ", dimension " << array.Dimension() << std::endl;
00118       }
00119 
00120       BabelShark::InstructionSet* pInstructionSet = new BabelShark::InstructionSet(array.Dimension(), (char*)m_sName.c_str()); // TODO: fix "char*"
00121       PDI::Array::const_iterator it(array.Begin()),
00122                                    itEnd(array.End());
00123       for (; it != itEnd; ++it)
00124       {
00125          TreeVisitor visitor(it->Name(), m_bDisplayOutputToScreen);
00126          it->Accept(visitor);
00127 
00128          pInstructionSet->Add(visitor.GetInstruction());
00129       }
00130 
00131       m_pInstruction = pInstructionSet;
00132    }
00133 
00141    virtual void Visit(const PDI::DisplayElement& string) {
00142       std::istringstream ss(string);
00143 
00144       std::string sType;
00145       int nSize;
00146       ss >> sType >> nSize;
00147 
00148       CreateInstructionFuncMap::const_iterator it = m_CreateInstructionFuncMap.find(sType);
00149       if (it == m_CreateInstructionFuncMap.end())
00150       {
00151          std::string sException = "use of undefined type: " + sType;
00152          throw std::exception(sException.c_str());
00153       }
00154       else
00155       {
00156          if (m_bDisplayOutputToScreen)
00157          {
00158             std::cout << "This leaf node has been visited " << m_sName << " " << sType << " " << nSize << std::endl;
00159          }
00160       }
00161 
00162       CreateInstructionFunc func = it->second;
00163       m_pInstruction = (this->*func)(nSize, m_sName);
00164    }
00165 
00170    virtual void Visit(const PDI::Null& null) { throw std::runtime_error("ERROR: should never see NULL element"); }
00171 
00172    typedef BabelShark::Instruction* (TreeVisitor::*CreateInstructionFunc)(unsigned int, const std::string&);
00173    typedef std::map<std::string, CreateInstructionFunc> CreateInstructionFuncMap;
00174 
00175    CreateInstructionFuncMap m_CreateInstructionFuncMap;
00176 
00177    std::string m_sName;
00178    BabelShark::Instruction* m_pInstruction;  // This is used so that one visit function may see the instruction from another.
00179    bool m_bDisplayOutputToScreen;
00180 };
